Integral $\oint_{|z-c|=R} \frac{dz}{z-w} = 2πi$ whenever $|w-c| < R$.

type: ∀ {c w : ℂ} {R : ℝ}, w ∈ Metric.ball c R → (∮ (z : ℂ) in C(c, R), (z - w)⁻¹) = 2 * ↑Real.pi * Complex.I
name: circleIntegral.integral_sub_inv_of_mem_ball
docString: Integral $\oint_{|z-c|=R} \frac{dz}{z-w} = 2πi$ whenever $|w-c| < R$.

For any complex numbers `c` and `w` with `|z-c|<R`, the contour integral of `1/(z-w)` over the circle centered at `c` with radius `R` is equal to `2πi`.

type: ∀ {c w : ℂ} {R : ℝ}, w ∈ Metric.ball c R → (∮ (z : ℂ) in C(c, R), (z - w)⁻¹) = 2 * ↑Real.pi * Complex.I
name: circleIntegral.integral_sub_inv_of_mem_ball
docString: For any complex numbers `c` and `w` with `|z-c|<R`, the contour integral of `1/(z-w)` over the circle centered at `c` with radius `R` is equal to `2πi`.

The theorem states that for any integer `n` that is not equal to -1, and for any complex numbers `c` and `w`, and any real number `R`, the integral of `(z - w) ^ n` over a circle centered at `c` with radius `R` is equal to zero. This integral is computed over complex numbers `z` along the circle.

name: circleIntegral.integral_sub_zpow_of_ne
docString: The theorem states that for any integer `n` that is not equal to -1, and for any complex numbers `c` and `w`, and any real number `R`, the integral of `(z - w) ^ n` over a circle centered at `c` with radius `R` is equal to zero. This integral is computed over complex numbers `z` along the circle.

If `n < 0` and `|w - c| = |R|`, then `(z - w) ^ n` is not circle integrable on the circle with
center `c` and radius `|R|`, so the integral `∮ z in C(c, R), (z - w) ^ n` is equal to zero.

type: ∀ {n : ℤ} {c w : ℂ} {R : ℝ}, n < 0 → w ∈ Metric.sphere c |R| → (∮ (z : ℂ) in C(c, R), (z - w) ^ n) = 0
name: circleIntegral.integral_sub_zpow_of_undef
docString:
If `n < 0` and `|w - c| = |R|`, then `(z - w) ^ n` is not circle integrable on the circle with
center `c` and radius `|R|`, so the integral `∮ z in C(c, R), (z - w) ^ n` is equal to zero.

For any nonnegative real numbers $w\_1, w\_2, z\_1,$ and $z\_2$ with $w\_1 + w\_2 = 1,$ and for any real number $p \ge 1,$ we have $w\_1 * z\_1^p + w\_2 * z\_2^p \le (w\_1 * z\_1 + w\_2 * z\_2) ^ p.$

type: ∀ (w₁ w₂ z₁ z₂ : NNReal), w₁ + w₂ = 1 → ∀ {p : ℝ}, 1 ≤ p → (w₁ * z₁ + w₂ * z₂) ^ p ≤ w₁ * z₁ ^ p + w₂ * z₂ ^ p
name: NNReal.rpow_arith_mean_le_arith_mean2_rpow
docString: For any nonnegative real numbers $w\_1, w\_2, z\_1,$ and $z\_2$ with $w\_1 + w\_2 = 1,$ and for any real number $p \ge 1,$ we have $w\_1 * z\_1^p + w\_2 * z\_2^p \le (w\_1 * z\_1 + w\_2 * z\_2) ^ p.$

This theorem states that for any integer `n`, complex numbers `c` and `w`, and a real number `R`, if `n` is less than zero and `w` lies on the sphere with center `c` and radius `|R|` (i.e., the distance from `w` to `c` equals `|R|`), then the complex line integral of `(z - w) ^ n` over the circle `C(c, R)` is equal to zero. In other words, the integral of the function `(z - w) ^ n` with respect to `z` along the circular path centered at `c` with radius `R` is zero under these conditions.

type: ∀ {n : ℤ} {c w : ℂ} {R : ℝ}, n < 0 → w ∈ Metric.sphere c |R| → (∮ (z : ℂ) in C(c, R), (z - w) ^ n) = 0
name: circleIntegral.integral_sub_zpow_of_undef
docString: This theorem states that for any integer `n`, complex numbers `c` and `w`, and a real number `R`, if `n` is less than zero and `w` lies on the sphere with center `c` and radius `|R|` (i.e., the distance from `w` to `c` equals `|R|`), then the complex line integral of `(z - w) ^ n` over the circle `C(c, R)` is equal to zero. In other words, the integral of the function `(z - w) ^ n` with respect to `z` along the circular path centered at `c` with radius `R` is zero under these conditions.

Definition for $\oint_{|z-c|=R} f(z)\,dz$.

type: {E : Type u_1} → [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] → [inst : NormedSpace ℂ E] → (ℂ → E) → ℂ → ℝ → E
name: circleIntegral
docString: Definition for $\oint_{|z-c|=R} f(z)\,dz$.

A Lebesgue Integral from -∞ to y can be expressed as the sum of one from -∞ to 0 and 0 to x

type:
∀ {y z : ℝ} (f : ℝ → ENNReal),
  z ≤ y → ∫⁻ (x : ℝ) in Set.Iic y, f x = (∫⁻ (x : ℝ) in Set.Iio z, f x) + ∫⁻ (x : ℝ) in Set.Icc z y, f x
name: lintegral_Iic_eq_lintegral_Iio_add_Icc
docString: A Lebesgue Integral from -∞ to y can be expressed as the sum of one from -∞ to 0 and 0 to x

Hölder's inequality in case of finite non-zero integrals

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : MeasurableSpace α] {μ : MeasureTheory.Measure α} {p q : ℝ},
  Real.IsConjugateExponent p q →
    ∀ {f g : α → ENNReal},
      AEMeasurable f →
        ∫⁻ (a : α), f a ^ p ∂μ ≠ ⊤ →
          ∫⁻ (a : α), g a ^ q ∂μ ≠ ⊤ →
            ∫⁻ (a : α), f a ^ p ∂μ ≠ 0 →
              ∫⁻ (a : α), g a ^ q ∂μ ≠ 0 →
                ∫⁻ (a : α), (f * g) a ∂μ ≤ (∫⁻ (a : α), f a ^ p ∂μ) ^ (1 / p) * (∫⁻ (a : α), g a ^ q ∂μ) ^ (1 / q)
name: ENNReal.lintegral_mul_le_Lp_mul_Lq_of_ne_zero_of_ne_top
docString: Hölder's inequality in case of finite non-zero integrals

**Cauchy integral formula**: if `f : ℂ → ℂ` is continuous on a closed disc of radius `R` and is
complex differentiable at all but countably many points of its interior, then for any `w` in this
interior we have $\oint_{|z-c|=R}\frac{f(z)}{z-w}dz=2\pi i\,f(w)$.

type:
∀ {R : ℝ} {c w : ℂ} {s : Set ℂ},
  Set.Countable s →
    w ∈ Metric.ball c R →
      ∀ {f : ℂ → ℂ},
        ContinuousOn f (Metric.closedBall c R) →
          (∀ z ∈ Metric.ball c R \ s, DifferentiableAt ℂ f z) →
            (∮ (z : ℂ) in C(c, R), f z / (z - w)) = 2 * ↑Real.pi * Complex.I * f w
name: Complex.circleIntegral_div_sub_of_differentiable_on_off_countable
docString:
**Cauchy integral formula**: if `f : ℂ → ℂ` is continuous on a closed disc of radius `R` and is
complex differentiable at all but countably many points of its interior, then for any `w` in this
interior we have $\oint_{|z-c|=R}\frac{f(z)}{z-w}dz=2\pi i\,f(w)$.

The integral of a nonnegative function w.r.t. a volume generated by a locally-finite measure is
nonnegative.

type:
∀ {ι : Type u} {I : BoxIntegral.Box ι} [inst : Fintype ι] {l : BoxIntegral.IntegrationParams} {g : (ι → ℝ) → ℝ},
  (∀ x ∈ BoxIntegral.Box.Icc I, 0 ≤ g x) →
    ∀ (μ : MeasureTheory.Measure (ι → ℝ)) [inst_1 : MeasureTheory.IsLocallyFiniteMeasure μ],
      0 ≤ BoxIntegral.integral I l g (BoxIntegral.BoxAdditiveMap.toSMul (MeasureTheory.Measure.toBoxAdditive μ))
name: BoxIntegral.integral_nonneg
docString:
The integral of a nonnegative function w.r.t. a volume generated by a locally-finite measure is
nonnegative.

**Cauchy integral formula**: if `f : ℂ → E` is complex differentiable on a closed disc of radius
`R`, then for any `w` in its interior we have $\oint_{|z-c|=R}(z-w)^{-1}f(z)\,dz=2πif(w)$.

type:
∀ {E : Type u} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℂ E] [inst_2 : CompleteSpace E] {R : ℝ} {c w : ℂ}
  {f : ℂ → E},
  DifferentiableOn ℂ f (Metric.closedBall c R) →
    w ∈ Metric.ball c R → (∮ (z : ℂ) in C(c, R), (z - w)⁻¹ • f z) = (2 * ↑Real.pi * Complex.I) • f w
name: DifferentiableOn.circleIntegral_sub_inv_smul
docString:
**Cauchy integral formula**: if `f : ℂ → E` is complex differentiable on a closed disc of radius
`R`, then for any `w` in its interior we have $\oint_{|z-c|=R}(z-w)^{-1}f(z)\,dz=2πif(w)$.

**Cauchy integral formula**: if `f : ℂ → E` is continuous on a closed disc of radius `R` and is
complex differentiable at all but countably many points of its interior, then for any `w` in this
interior we have $\frac{1}{2πi}\oint_{|z-c|=R}(z-w)^{-1}f(z)\,dz=f(w)$.

type:
∀ {E : Type u} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℂ E] [inst_2 : CompleteSpace E] {R : ℝ} {c w : ℂ}
  {f : ℂ → E} {s : Set ℂ},
  Set.Countable s →
    w ∈ Metric.ball c R →
      ContinuousOn f (Metric.closedBall c R) →
        (∀ x ∈ Metric.ball c R \ s, DifferentiableAt ℂ f x) →
          ((2 * ↑Real.pi * Complex.I)⁻¹ • ∮ (z : ℂ) in C(c, R), (z - w)⁻¹ • f z) = f w
name: Complex.two_pi_I_inv_smul_circleIntegral_sub_inv_smul_of_differentiable_on_off_countable
docString:
**Cauchy integral formula**: if `f : ℂ → E` is continuous on a closed disc of radius `R` and is
complex differentiable at all but countably many points of its interior, then for any `w` in this
interior we have $\frac{1}{2πi}\oint_{|z-c|=R}(z-w)^{-1}f(z)\,dz=f(w)$.

Suppose that a function `f : ℂ → E` is continuous on a closed rectangle with opposite corners at
`z w : ℂ`, is *real* differentiable on the corresponding open rectangle, and
$\frac{\partial f}{\partial \bar z}$ is integrable on this rectangle. Then the integral of `f` over
the boundary of the rectangle is equal to the integral of
$2i\frac{\partial f}{\partial \bar z}=i\frac{\partial f}{\partial x}-\frac{\partial f}{\partial y}$
over the rectangle.

type:
∀ {E : Type u} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℂ E] [inst_2 : CompleteSpace E] (f : ℂ → E)
  (f' : ℂ → ℂ →L[ℝ] E) (z w : ℂ),
  ContinuousOn f (Set.uIcc z.re w.re ×ℂ Set.uIcc z.im w.im) →
    (∀ x ∈ Set.Ioo (min z.re w.re) (max z.re w.re) ×ℂ Set.Ioo (min z.im w.im) (max z.im w.im), HasFDerivAt f (f' x) x) →
      MeasureTheory.IntegrableOn (fun z => Complex.I • (f' z) 1 - (f' z) Complex.I)
          (Set.uIcc z.re w.re ×ℂ Set.uIcc z.im w.im) →
        (((∫ (x : ℝ) in z.re..w.re, f (↑x + ↑z.im * Complex.I)) - ∫ (x : ℝ) in z.re..w.re, f (↑x + ↑w.im * Complex.I)) +
              Complex.I • ∫ (y : ℝ) in z.im..w.im, f (↑w.re + ↑y * Complex.I)) -
            Complex.I • ∫ (y : ℝ) in z.im..w.im, f (↑z.re + ↑y * Complex.I) =
          ∫ (x : ℝ) in z.re..w.re,
            ∫ (y : ℝ) in z.im..w.im, Complex.I • (f' (↑x + ↑y * Complex.I)) 1 - (f' (↑x + ↑y * Complex.I)) Complex.I
name: Complex.integral_boundary_rect_of_continuousOn_of_hasFDerivAt_real
docString:
Suppose that a function `f : ℂ → E` is continuous on a closed rectangle with opposite corners at
`z w : ℂ`, is *real* differentiable on the corresponding open rectangle, and
$\frac{\partial f}{\partial \bar z}$ is integrable on this rectangle. Then the integral of `f` over
the boundary of the rectangle is equal to the integral of
$2i\frac{\partial f}{\partial \bar z}=i\frac{\partial f}{\partial x}-\frac{\partial f}{\partial y}$
over the rectangle.

Suppose that a function `f : ℂ → E` is *real* differentiable on a closed rectangle with opposite
corners at `z w : ℂ` and $\frac{\partial f}{\partial \bar z}$ is integrable on this rectangle. Then
the integral of `f` over the boundary of the rectangle is equal to the integral of
$2i\frac{\partial f}{\partial \bar z}=i\frac{\partial f}{\partial x}-\frac{\partial f}{\partial y}$
over the rectangle.

type:
∀ {E : Type u} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℂ E] [inst_2 : CompleteSpace E] (f : ℂ → E)
  (z w : ℂ),
  DifferentiableOn ℝ f (Set.uIcc z.re w.re ×ℂ Set.uIcc z.im w.im) →
    MeasureTheory.IntegrableOn (fun z => Complex.I • (fderiv ℝ f z) 1 - (fderiv ℝ f z) Complex.I)
        (Set.uIcc z.re w.re ×ℂ Set.uIcc z.im w.im) →
      (((∫ (x : ℝ) in z.re..w.re, f (↑x + ↑z.im * Complex.I)) - ∫ (x : ℝ) in z.re..w.re, f (↑x + ↑w.im * Complex.I)) +
            Complex.I • ∫ (y : ℝ) in z.im..w.im, f (↑w.re + ↑y * Complex.I)) -
          Complex.I • ∫ (y : ℝ) in z.im..w.im, f (↑z.re + ↑y * Complex.I) =
        ∫ (x : ℝ) in z.re..w.re,
          ∫ (y : ℝ) in z.im..w.im,
            Complex.I • (fderiv ℝ f (↑x + ↑y * Complex.I)) 1 - (fderiv ℝ f (↑x + ↑y * Complex.I)) Complex.I
name: Complex.integral_boundary_rect_of_differentiableOn_real
docString:
Suppose that a function `f : ℂ → E` is *real* differentiable on a closed rectangle with opposite
corners at `z w : ℂ` and $\frac{\partial f}{\partial \bar z}$ is integrable on this rectangle. Then
the integral of `f` over the boundary of the rectangle is equal to the integral of
$2i\frac{\partial f}{\partial \bar z}=i\frac{\partial f}{\partial x}-\frac{\partial f}{\partial y}$
over the rectangle.

**Cauchy integral formula**: if `f : ℂ → E` is continuous on a closed disc of radius `R` and is
complex differentiable at all but countably many points of its interior, then for any `w` in this
interior we have $\oint_{|z-c|=R}(z-w)^{-1}f(z)\,dz=2πif(w)$.

type:
∀ {E : Type u} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℂ E] [inst_2 : CompleteSpace E] {R : ℝ} {c w : ℂ}
  {f : ℂ → E} {s : Set ℂ},
  Set.Countable s →
    w ∈ Metric.ball c R →
      ContinuousOn f (Metric.closedBall c R) →
        (∀ x ∈ Metric.ball c R \ s, DifferentiableAt ℂ f x) →
          (∮ (z : ℂ) in C(c, R), (z - w)⁻¹ • f z) = (2 * ↑Real.pi * Complex.I) • f w
name: Complex.circleIntegral_sub_inv_smul_of_differentiable_on_off_countable
docString:
**Cauchy integral formula**: if `f : ℂ → E` is continuous on a closed disc of radius `R` and is
complex differentiable at all but countably many points of its interior, then for any `w` in this
interior we have $\oint_{|z-c|=R}(z-w)^{-1}f(z)\,dz=2πif(w)$.

If `f : ℂ → E` is continuous on the closed annulus `r ≤ ‖z - c‖ ≤ R`, `0 < r ≤ R`,
and is complex differentiable at all but countably many points of its interior,
then the integrals of `f z / (z - c)` (formally, `(z - c)⁻¹ • f z`)
over the circles `‖z - c‖ = r` and `‖z - c‖ = R` are equal to each other.

type:
∀ {E : Type u} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℂ E] [inst_2 : CompleteSpace E] {c : ℂ} {r R : ℝ},
  0 < r →
    r ≤ R →
      ∀ {f : ℂ → E} {s : Set ℂ},
        Set.Countable s →
          ContinuousOn f (Metric.closedBall c R \ Metric.ball c r) →
            (∀ z ∈ (Metric.ball c R \ Metric.closedBall c r) \ s, DifferentiableAt ℂ f z) →
              (∮ (z : ℂ) in C(c, R), (z - c)⁻¹ • f z) = ∮ (z : ℂ) in C(c, r), (z - c)⁻¹ • f z
name: Complex.circleIntegral_sub_center_inv_smul_eq_of_differentiable_on_annulus_off_countable
docString:
If `f : ℂ → E` is continuous on the closed annulus `r ≤ ‖z - c‖ ≤ R`, `0 < r ≤ R`,
and is complex differentiable at all but countably many points of its interior,
then the integrals of `f z / (z - c)` (formally, `(z - c)⁻¹ • f z`)
over the circles `‖z - c‖ = r` and `‖z - c‖ = R` are equal to each other.

The function `λ z, (z - w) ^ n`, `n : ℤ`, is circle integrable on the circle with center `c` and
radius `|R|` if and only if `R = 0` or `0 ≤ n`, or `w` does not belong to this circle.

type: ∀ {c w : ℂ} {R : ℝ} {n : ℤ}, CircleIntegrable (fun z => (z - w) ^ n) c R ↔ R = 0 ∨ 0 ≤ n ∨ w ∉ Metric.sphere c |R|
name: circleIntegrable_sub_zpow_iff
docString:
The function `λ z, (z - w) ^ n`, `n : ℤ`, is circle integrable on the circle with center `c` and
radius `|R|` if and only if `R = 0` or `0 ≤ n`, or `w` does not belong to this circle.

**Cauchy integral formula**: if `f : ℂ → E` is complex differentiable on an open disc and is
continuous on its closure, then for any `w` in this open ball we have
$\oint_{|z-c|=R}(z-w)^{-1}f(z)\,dz=2πif(w)$.

type:
∀ {E : Type u} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℂ E] [inst_2 : CompleteSpace E] {R : ℝ} {c w : ℂ}
  {f : ℂ → E},
  DiffContOnCl ℂ f (Metric.ball c R) →
    w ∈ Metric.ball c R → (∮ (z : ℂ) in C(c, R), (z - w)⁻¹ • f z) = (2 * ↑Real.pi * Complex.I) • f w
name: DiffContOnCl.circleIntegral_sub_inv_smul
docString:
**Cauchy integral formula**: if `f : ℂ → E` is complex differentiable on an open disc and is
continuous on its closure, then for any `w` in this open ball we have
$\oint_{|z-c|=R}(z-w)^{-1}f(z)\,dz=2πif(w)$.

Riemann-Lebesgue lemma for functions on a real inner-product space: the integral
`∫ v, exp (-2 * π * ⟪w, v⟫ * I) • f v` tends to 0 as `w → ∞`.

type:
∀ {E : Type u_1} {V : Type u_2} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℂ E] (f : V → E)
  [inst_2 : NormedAddCommGroup V] [inst_3 : MeasurableSpace V] [inst_4 : BorelSpace V] [inst_5 : InnerProductSpace ℝ V]
  [inst_6 : FiniteDimensional ℝ V],
  Filter.Tendsto (fun w => ∫ (v : V), ↑(Real.fourierChar (Multiplicative.ofAdd (-⟪v, w⟫_ℝ))) • f v) (Filter.cocompact V)
    (nhds 0)
name: tendsto_integral_exp_inner_smul_cocompact
docString:
Riemann-Lebesgue lemma for functions on a real inner-product space: the integral
`∫ v, exp (-2 * π * ⟪w, v⟫ * I) • f v` tends to 0 as `w → ∞`.

**Cauchy integral formula** for the value at the center of a disc. If `f : ℂ → E` is continuous
on a closed disc of radius `R` and is complex differentiable at all but countably many points of its
interior, then the integral $\oint_{|z-c|=R} \frac{f(z)}{z-c}\,dz$ is equal to `2πiy`.

type:
∀ {E : Type u} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℂ E] [inst_2 : CompleteSpace E] {R : ℝ},
  0 < R →
    ∀ {f : ℂ → E} {c : ℂ} {s : Set ℂ},
      Set.Countable s →
        ContinuousOn f (Metric.closedBall c R) →
          (∀ z ∈ Metric.ball c R \ s, DifferentiableAt ℂ f z) →
            (∮ (z : ℂ) in C(c, R), (z - c)⁻¹ • f z) = (2 * ↑Real.pi * Complex.I) • f c
name: Complex.circleIntegral_sub_center_inv_smul_of_differentiable_on_off_countable
docString:
**Cauchy integral formula** for the value at the center of a disc. If `f : ℂ → E` is continuous
on a closed disc of radius `R` and is complex differentiable at all but countably many points of its
interior, then the integral $\oint_{|z-c|=R} \frac{f(z)}{z-c}\,dz$ is equal to `2πiy`.

**Cauchy integral formula**: if `f : ℂ → E` is complex differentiable on an open disc and is
continuous on its closure, then for any `w` in this open ball we have
$\frac{1}{2πi}\oint_{|z-c|=R}(z-w)^{-1}f(z)\,dz=f(w)$.

type:
∀ {E : Type u} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℂ E] [inst_2 : CompleteSpace E] {R : ℝ} {c w : ℂ}
  {f : ℂ → E},
  DiffContOnCl ℂ f (Metric.ball c R) →
    w ∈ Metric.ball c R → ((2 * ↑Real.pi * Complex.I)⁻¹ • ∮ (z : ℂ) in C(c, R), (z - w)⁻¹ • f z) = f w
name: DiffContOnCl.two_pi_i_inv_smul_circleIntegral_sub_inv_smul
docString:
**Cauchy integral formula**: if `f : ℂ → E` is complex differentiable on an open disc and is
continuous on its closure, then for any `w` in this open ball we have
$\frac{1}{2πi}\oint_{|z-c|=R}(z-w)^{-1}f(z)\,dz=f(w)$.
